case_title: MUHAMMAD HASHIM KHAN AND OTHERS vs PROVINCE OF BALUCHISTAN AND OTHERS
complaint_summary: Petitioners, who are civil servants, alleged illegal dismissal, compulsory retirement, transfer, and denial of seniority.
investigation_summary: The court reviewed the establishment of the Baluchistan Services Tribunal under Act V of 1974 and its exclusive jurisdiction over civil servant service matters.
judgment_summary: The petitions were dismissed as the matters fell under the exclusive jurisdiction of the Baluchistan Services Tribunal established under Act V of 1974. The court held that the Tribunal had the authority to adjudicate on all service-related disputes, including disciplinary matters.
legal_arguments: Tribunal's exclusive jurisdiction under Act V of 1974
Bar on other courts under Article 212(2) of the Constitution
Tribunal's authority to examine mala fide actions and ultra vires laws
statutes: Provincial Services Tribunal (Extension of the Provisions of the Constitution) (Amendment) Act, 1976
Article 212 of the Constitution of Pakistan
key_issues: Conflict with Fundamental Rights under Article 25 of the Constitution

legal_terms.ultra vires: Beyond the legal power or authority of a person or institution

words_and_phrases.abate: To put an end to or nullify
words_and_phrases.exclusive jurisdiction: Authority of a tribunal or court to hear and decide specific types of cases

summary_vector_notes: The case involved multiple petitions by civil servants challenging their dismissal, compulsory retirement, transfer, and denial of seniority. The court ruled that the Baluchistan Services Tribunal had exclusive jurisdiction over such matters under Act V of 1974, and dismissed the petitions accordingly.
